About This Game



Life on Tiny Planet was calm and carefree until a great disaster occurred - Tiny Planet was hit by a meteor! The world fell apart and now its future depends only on you! Use your imagination and creativity: in order to restore Tiny Planet and help its inhabitants you will have to fix a variety of machines and mechanisms as well as solve puzzles in each of the five chapters of this game. Navigation is simple and intuitive. It doesn't distract you from the witty brain teasers, and you will be able to fully immerse yourself in the unique atmosphere of the game.

  • There is no text in this game. It is fun for all ages and suitable for the whole family!
  • Five vastly different chapters and over 30 exciting brain teasers (minigames)
  • A bright, gorgeous world drawn entirely by hand
  • Absorbing game play and simple navigation
  • 10 enchanting musical themes
READ MORE

One of the best puzzle games I ever played. Love the art (which is handdrawn). Refreshing that it has no text at all and is good for all ages.

Lsh

3 reviews
Recommended
18.0 hrs on record
Posted: July 17
Excellent game - mostly relaxing (with a few annoying/difficult puzzles). If you like hidden object puzzle games, this one is a must, as it's different from usual hidden object games.

It's not TOO long, I'm currently on my third play through with just over 15 hours, so it's up to you if you want to pay full price, although I'd still argue that it's worth it. If you see it on sale, definitly get it!

pearadise
175 products in account
17 reviews
Recommended
7.3 hrs on record
Posted: July 18
This is a calm, relaxing, hidden object game with little puzzles included in each level. Some puzzles present more challenge than others, obviously the further into the game you get the harder the puzzle. It's not a long game but you won't feel ripped off for $5. No worries if you can't find a hidden object, the flies will help you. There is also an interesting little story to the game if you're paying attention. Nothing deep, just a little history of the townsfolk. Definitrly recommended for those looking for something casual and relaxing.

Rorokins
106 products in account
7 reviews
Recommended
14.6 hrs on record
Posted: June 17
I genuinely really love this game. It's pretty, has a lovely soundtrack, and isn't really so challenging that it puts you off playing. There are only two moments that really feel like a drag (the boat and the plane), but they barely tarnish my enjoyment. The characters are all entertaining to look at, and their connection with the man who seems to essentially have built this world is quite sweet. I would strongly recommend buying this at full price, but it sells for 99p durig sales if you're unsure.

Was this review helpful? Yes No Funny
2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
Emblem Parade
2,357 products in account
67 reviews
Recommended
5.6 hrs on record
Posted: September 8
A gorgeous and somewhat challenging hidden-object game, with several nice puzzles and a few simple mini-games.

Well, I recommend it, but keep your expectations low. There is no story and no point-and-click adventuring, Your only task is to find all the objects. And they are quite hard to find indeed! Supposedly you need to collect all the puzzle pieces, but I did not and still completed the game.

If you've enjoyed the audio-visual style here, I strongly recommend Amanita Design's games--Machinarium, Botanicula--which offer wonderful stories and much more gameplay.

If you've enjoyed the gamplay here, well, "hidden-object games" is a huge genre. There are many excellent "HOGs" on Steam. Welcome aborad!

Finally, I'd like to thank the developer for supporting Linux.
